topic.title: GIF Time - Can anyone post?
topic.body: Just wondering if it is possible to upload GIF's to GIF Time.

topic.title: ZeroID running out of size limit.
topic.body: If users do not increase the size limit of ZeroID, what will be the repercussions?

topic.title: ZeroTorrent .torrent hosting
topic.body:
I cannot download the following .torrent file.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroTorrent.bit/?Topic:16_1Av4nvMzFu3DE92iGS2JpBXBBngF7NkKr/Under+The+Skin+2013+1080p+x265+6ch+Eng+HE+AAC+BTC
I want to know, how can the .torrent file go missing? Would not all who are hosting this zite be hosting this .torrent (including myself)?
On another note, why are we using .torrent files? I though the shift to using magnet links would be better in all respects.

topic.title: Who runs ZeroName?
topic.body: If I'm correct in assuming ZeroName is used as the ZeroNet DNS, is ZeroName not a centralised point of failure?  Could the operator not change their intent and make it malicious?  Is there a way to run a namecoin node to ensure that the database is correct and are being directed to the correct site?

1_1tdPArKBRcAcJxnKWHbAv6NuXP4rZmRSR.body: I have just seen the "Following" icon at the top. This seems to be the decider for the ZeroHello page.

8_18Cxdyc2FEuswoXnBkrAfCkM2Yu1p4NjcR.body: Not so needed for zeronet sites as there is no cost of hosting.  I can imagine it would be good for users to be able to pay or donate to uploaders and artists.  As long as users have some incentive to allow the miner to run, whether that be good will, reputation points, etc. as long as it is not pay to access.

2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body:
I am testing webtorrent in zeronet.  May be a good way for using large videos in zeronet? thought they will have to be hosted by a webseed or a torrent client (webtorrent client)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1P6TXsP2e5REni5AEdZRkunXiqYxn8Rsmr/
http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Qc6UFBAeGyxBNQFW2DxwMvpepUU1mHDs/
Currently set to stream Sintel - a free movie.  The first sites I've made on here so they probably wont work.
